item.title: Lyft 公布预订和展望超预期，并扩大回购规模
item.description: Lyft 公司公布的第一季度总预订量好于预期，与其规模更大的打车服务竞争对手优步（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Lyft Inc. reported better-than-expected gross bookings in the first quarter, drawing a sharp contrast with the disappointing results issued by its much-larger ride-hailing rival Uber Technologies Inc. a day earlier.】

item.title: 收入前景超出预期，Pinterest 股价上涨
item.description: Pinterest 公司第二季度营收超出预期中值，进一步缓解了同行对广告业务下滑的担忧。截至纽约时间下午 4:06 时，该公司股价在盘后交易中攀升了 11%。【原文：Pinterest Inc. guided second-quarter revenue ahead of the estimates at the midpoint, further easing concerns of an advertising downturn among its peers. The shares climbed 11% in post-market trading as of 4:06 pm New York time.】

item.title: Instagram 主管称该应用多年来一直担心 TikTok 的威胁
item.description: Instagram 首席执行官亚当-莫塞里（Adam Mosseri）说，Instagram 的一小部分内容来自用户与家人和朋友的互动，因为该应用更注重视频产品，以与 TikTok 竞争，他试图抵御政府对 Meta Platforms 公司垄断社交媒体的指控。【原文：A small portion of Instagram’s content comes from users engaging with family and friends as the app focuses more on video offerings to compete with TikTok, the platform’s chief Adam Mosseri said, seeking to fend off government claims that Meta Platforms Inc. monopolizes social media.】

item.title: Celsius 创始人亚历克斯-马辛斯基（Alex Mashinsky）因加密货币欺诈被判 12 年监禁
item.description: 加密货币贷款公司 Celsius Network 的创始人亚历克斯-马辛斯基（Alex Mashinsky）被判处 12 年监禁，因为他的公司以数字资产存款的高利率为诱饵，欺骗了数十万客户。【原文：Alex Mashinsky, the founder of cryptocurrency lender Celsius Network, was ordered to spend 12 years in prison for defrauding hundreds of thousands of customers lured by his firm’s high interest rates on digital-asset deposits.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行称，私人信贷有望获得 22 万亿美元的信贷总额
item.description: 据巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）周四发布的一份研究报告称，私人贷款机构通过向不稳定的公司提供信贷，已经成为传统银行的强劲对手，现在也在向蓝筹股借款人大举进军。【原文：Private lenders that have already established themselves as fierce rivals to traditional banks by extending credit to shaky companies are now making major inroads with blue-chip borrowers as well, according to a research report from Barclays Plc on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普的英国贸易协议仍有关键问题未解决
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统将其与英国达成的贸易框架说成是一项历史性成就，是他彻底改革全球经济的革命性努力的第一步。【原文：President Donald Trump pitched his trade framework with the UK as a historic achievement, and the first step in his revolutionary effort to overhaul the global economy.】

item.title: 壳牌加拿大液化天然气公司计划最快于 6 月底进行首次出口
item.description: 壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）在加拿大的液化天然气项目是该国第一个大规模的液化天然气出口终端，该项目正准备最快于 6 月底开始海外销售。【原文：Shell Plc’s liquefied natural gas project in Canada, the country’s first large-scale export terminal for the fuel, is preparing to begin overseas sales as soon as late June.】

item.title: 鲍威尔在特朗普的攻击下获得加拿大央行行长马克莱姆的支持
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）表示支持美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔免受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的攻击，这位加拿大政策制定者称中央银行的独立性 "神圣不可侵犯"。【原文：Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem offered support to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell from US President Donald Trump’s attacks, as the Canadian policymaker called the independence of central banks “sacrosanct.”】

item.title: 汽车零部件制造商利纳马成为特朗普关税的意外赢家
item.description: 加拿大汽车零部件制造商利纳马公司一度被认为是美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对汽车和金属征收关税的牺牲品，但该公司表示，它现在可能是贸易战的受益者。【原文：Canadian auto parts maker Linamar Corp., once thought to be a casualty of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on cars and metals, says it’s now a possible beneficiary of the trade war.】

item.title: 布拉德斯科飙升幅度创 2020 年以来之最，扭亏为盈雏形初现
item.description: 巴西布雷德斯科银行（Banco Bradesco SA）在首席执行官马塞洛-诺罗尼亚（Marcelo Noronha）约一年半前接手后，终于开始收获扭亏为盈的成果。【原文：Brazilian bank Banco Bradesco SA has finally begun to reap the results of a turnaround process that started when Chief Executive Officer Marcelo Noronha took the reins about a year and a half ago.】

item.title: 如果英美贸易协定是赢家，那么输家是什么？
item.description:
这一切感觉就像是开始的结束，而不是结束的开始。【原文：

This all feels like the end of the beginning, rather than the beginning of the end.

】

item.title: 加密货币支持的稳定币法案在特朗普 Memecoin 引起的轩然大波中受阻
item.description: 参议院民主党人阻止了数字资产行业支持的稳定币立法，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统广泛且不断增长的加密货币投资组合引起了轩然大波。【原文：Senate Democrats blocked stablecoin legislation backed by the digital assets industry amid a furor over President Donald Trump’s extensive and growing portfolio of crypto ventures.】

item.title: 旧金山市长为无家可归者收容所床位寻找亿万富翁
item.description: 旧金山市长丹尼尔-卢里（Daniel Lurie）在该市面临巨大预算赤字的情况下，向美国最富有的慈善家们求助，以推进其解决无家可归者问题的议程。【原文：San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie has turned to some of the country’s wealthiest philanthropists to advance his agenda on homelessness while the city faces a daunting budget deficit.】

item.title: 萨默斯称台币跳水凸显国债数学问题
item.description: 美国前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）说，台湾是美国金融资产的主要投资者，最近台湾货币飙升显示了特朗普政府尚未解决的一个关键挑战：流入美国的资本有可能减少。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said the recent surge in the currency of Taiwan — a major investor in American financial assets — showcases a key challenge that the Trump administration has yet to address: the potential for reduced capital inflows to the US.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，播客交易再次升温
item.description:
随着线性电视业务的衰退，广播公司对播客们虎视眈眈，而投资者们则向独立网络注入资金

。【原文：

As the linear TV business falters, broadcasters are eyeing podcasters while investors pump cash into independent networks

】

item.title: 消费者监督机构叫停拜登时代的谷歌支付监管工作
item.description: 消费者金融保护局终止了对 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌支付公司（Google Payment Corp.【原文：The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau discontinued its order designating the supervision of Alphabet Inc.’s Google Payment Corp., reversing a Biden-era decision to monitor the nonbank financial platform.】

item.title: 被激怒的 "哥伦比亚总统在 80 人被捕后抨击抗议者
item.description: 镇压行动非常迅速，传达的信息也非常明确：哥伦比亚大学对在校园内制造混乱的抗议者绝不姑息。【原文：The crackdown was swift and the message was unequivocal: Columbia University has little tolerance for protesters who spark chaos on campus.】

item.title: 美国大学小额债券落后于基准，高等教育风险日益增加
item.description: 4 月份，美国高校出售的市政债券表现逊于州和地方政府基准债券，这表明投资者对这一行业的态度越来越谨慎。【原文：Municipal bonds sold by US colleges and universities underperformed the state and local government benchmark in April, a sign that investors are growing more cautious on the sector.】

item.title: 交易员认为当地利率达到顶峰，巴西股市创下历史新高
item.description: 在全球市场普遍反弹和当地利率接近顶峰的预期下，巴西股市周四创下历史新高。【原文：Brazil’s stock market hit an all-time high Thursday amid a broad rally in global markets and expectations that local interest rates are nearing a peak.】

item.title: 巴西对冲基金本月创纪录，里约交易商获利 37
item.description: 上个月，巴西对冲基金从全球金融市场的混乱中获利，Vista Capital 的交易员取得了 37% 的回报率，领跑群雄。【原文：Brazilian hedge funds profited from the mayhem in global financial markets last month, with traders at Vista Capital registering a 37% return to lead the pack.】

item.title: 苹果正在为眼镜、新 Mac 和人工智能服务器开发专用芯片
item.description: 苹果公司的硅设计小组正在开发新的芯片，这些芯片将成为未来设备的大脑，包括首款智能眼镜、功能更强大的 Mac 和人工智能服务器。【原文：Apple Inc.’s silicon design group is working on new chips that will serve as the brains for future devices, including its first smart glasses, more powerful Macs and artificial intelligence servers.】

item.title: 英国房主可感谢特朗普促使英国央行降息
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易政策正在颠覆长期以来建立的联盟，威胁全球经济增长，并给企业带来混乱。不过，对于英国的房主来说，这一切都很顺利。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s trade policy is upending long-held alliances, threatening global growth and causing mayhem for business. For UK homeowners, though, it is working out quite well.】

item.title: 尽管受到特朗普的批评，鲍威尔仍让国会站在他一边
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的无情打击下，杰罗姆-鲍威尔需要他能得到的所有盟友；而他在国会中拥有很多盟友，包括那些对抛弃这位美联储主席没有多大兴趣的共和党人。【原文：Under relentless attack from President Donald Trump, Jerome Powell needs all the allies he can get — and he has plenty in Congress, including among Republicans who show little appetite for ditching the Federal Reserve chief.】

item.title: 与特朗普儿子合作的比特币矿商收入下降
item.description: 比特币挖矿公司Hut 8 Corp.最近与唐纳德-特朗普总统的儿子们合作成立了一家新企业，该公司表示其第一季度盈利转为亏损，收入暴跌50%以上。【原文：Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 Corp., which recently partnered with President Donald Trump’s sons on a new venture, said its first-quarter earnings swung to a loss and revenue tumbled by more than 50%.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率维持在 6.76% 的水平
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率维持在上周的水平，使购房者的压力居高不下。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US stayed put at levels reached last week, keeping the pressure high for homebuyers.】

item.title: 特朗普认为 "实质性 "对华谈判可能带来关税削减
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他相信本周末与中国启动的贸易谈判将取得切实进展，他预测中国政府将愿意做出让步，并表示如果谈判势头明显，他可以考虑削减对中国的惩罚性关税。【原文：US President Donald Trump said he believed trade negotiations launching this weekend with China would result in tangible progress, predicting Beijing would be willing to make concessions and saying he could consider cutting punishing tariffs against the country if there were significant momentum.】

item.title: 必和必拓支持的索尔金矿公司（SolGold）转向加快采矿计划以吸引投资者
item.description: 索尔黄金公司（SolGold Plc）是一家专注于厄瓜多尔的公司，得到了矿业界一些大公司的支持，该公司正在研究比先前计划提前三四年在其旗舰项目投产的方案。【原文：SolGold Plc, an Ecuador-focused firm backed by some of the biggest names in mining, is working on options to start production at its flagship project three or four years ahead of previous plans.】

item.title: 美洲和西班牙的良好业绩推动 Enel 利润增长
item.description: Enel SpA 第一季度利润超出预期，主要得益于其在拉丁美洲和西班牙的良好业绩。【原文：Enel SpA’s first-quarter profit beat expectations thanks largely to its good performance in Latin America and Spain.】

item.title: 三张图看贸易战如何加剧加拿大的房贷压力
item.description: 加拿大银行警告说，一场严重而持久的全球贸易战可能会导致更多的抵押贷款借款人拖欠还款，甚至超过全球金融危机时的水平。【原文：The Bank of Canada warned that a severe and long-lasting global trade war may cause more mortgage borrowers to fall behind on their payments — even beyond levels reached in the global financial crisis.】

item.title: 英国《商业周刊》称，福特正岌岌可危地维持着高等级评级
item.description: 据彭博情报公司（Bloomberg Intelligence）的一份报告称，福特汽车公司在 S&P 全球评级公司保持其投资级地位的机会 "微乎其微"，因为关税成本对该汽车制造商的利润率造成了压力。【原文：Ford Motor Co. has a “razor-thin” chance of keeping its investment-grade status at S&P Global Ratings, as tariff costs weigh on the carmaker’s profit margins, according to a report from Bloomberg Intelligence.】
